revised_title: The Brain's Temperature and Its Relation to Psychical Activity
tldr: Angelo Mosso investigates the temperature of the brain in relation to psychical activity using sensitive mercurial thermometers. He observes that during sleep, sensory stimuli can cause a slight increase in brain temperature without waking the subject. Mosso also examines the effects of narcotics, anaesthetics, and other factors on brain temperature and concludes that the physical basis of psychical processes is likely chemical action.
